Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Dr. Barbara Austin-Lucas, Agape International Fellowship, 8712 Glenwood Road, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11236.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Maisel.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Dr. Barbara Austin-Lucas, Agape International Fellowship, 8712 Glenwood Road, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11236..



On behalf of Council Member Maisel, the Public Advocate (Ms. James)  moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 31, 2015 be adopted as printed by Council Member Cumbo.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Cumbo moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 31, 2015 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Items.MinutesNote: None

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the Office of Management & Budget – Transfer City funds between various agencies in Fiscal Year 2015 to implement changes to the City's expense budget, pursuant to Section 107(b) of the New York City Charter. (MN-5)
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Transfer City funds between various agencies in FY'15 to implement changes to the City's expense budget. (MN-5)

Items.Title: Communication from the Office of Management & Budget – Appropriate new revenues of $1.074 billion in Fiscal Year 2015, pursuant to Section 107(e) of the New York City Charter. (MN-6)
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Appropriate new revenues of $1.074 billion in FY'15. (MN-6)

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Items.MinutesNote: None

Items.Title: Land Use Call-Ups
Items.MinutesNote: None

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Items.MinutesNote: None

Items.Title: Reports of Standing Committees
Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation granting New York City the authority to set its own minimum wage.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item:  Council Members Matteo and Ignizio.



The following Council Member formally abstained to vote on this item:  Council Member Ulrich.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Granting NYC the authority to set its own minimum wage.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign, legislation to grant the City of New York the authority to enforce State worker protection laws.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.


Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Grant NYC the authority to enforce State worker protection laws.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign, A.5501, strengthening the provisions of the Wage Theft Prevention Act.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Matteo and Ignizio.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Wage Theft Prevention Act. (A.5501)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, the Paid Family Leave Act to provide support and security for New York’s working families
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Matteo and Ignizio.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Paid Family Leave Act to provide support and security for NY’s working families.

The following Council Member formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Member Deutsch.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Recognizing this and every April as Organ Donation Awareness Month in the City of NY.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the application submitted by the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development and the decision of the City Planning Commission, ULURP No. C 150196 HAX, approving the designation of 986-996 Washington Avenue and 489-493 East 164th Street (Block 2369, Lots 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 53, 54, 90 and 153), the Bronx, as an Urban Development Action Area, and approving the project for the area as an Urban Development Action Area Project (L.U. No. 212; N 150196 HAX).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 212 - Planning, New Roads Plaza, Bronx (C150197ZSX)

Items.Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 150197 ZSX (L.U. No. 213), for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-902 of the Zoning Resolution to modify the requirements of Section 24-111 (Maximum floor area ratio for certain community facility uses) to permit the allowable community facility floor area ratio of Section 24-11 (Maximum Floor Area Ratio and Percentage of Lot Coverage) to apply to a non-profit institution with sleeping accommodations in connection with a proposed 8-story building on property located at 986-996 Washington Avenue a.k.a 489-493 East 164th Street (Block 2369, Lots 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 53, 54, 90 and 153), in an M1-1/ R7-2 District, with a Special Mixed Use District (MX-7), in Community District 3, Borough of the Bronx.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 213 - Planning, New Roads Plaza, Bronx (C150197ZSX)

Items.Title: Resolution approving the application submitted by the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development and the decision of the City Planning Commission, ULURP No. C 150175 HAX, approving the designation of property located at 1561 Walton Avenue (Block 2845, Lot 47), Borough of the Bronx, as an Urban Development Action Area, approving an Urban Development Action Area Project, and approving the disposition of city-owned property located at 1561 Walton Avenue (Block 2845, Lot 47) to a developer selected by HPD (L.U. No. 214; C 150175 HAX).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 214 - Planning, 1561 Walton Ave, Bronx (C150175HAX)

Items.Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 150174 PQX (L.U. No. 215), for the acquisition of property located at 1561 Walton Avenue (Block 2845, Lot 47), in Community District 4, Borough of the Bronx.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 215 - Planning, 1561 Walton Ave, Bronx (C150174PQX)

Items.Title: Resolution declaring the City of New York a "TPP-Free Zone" and urging Congress to oppose the Bipartisan Congressional Trade Priorities and Accountability Act of 2015 and not grant President Obama "fast-track" authority over, or permission to sign, the Trans-Pacific Partnership free trade agreement.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Matteo and Ignizio.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Declaring the City of New York a “TPP-Free Zone”.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Assembly to pass, and the Governor to sign A.6075, which would amend the labor law, in relation to the prohibition of differential pay based on gender.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.


Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Prohibition of differential pay based on gender. (A.6075/S.1)

Items.Title: Resolution approving decision of the City Planning Commission on Application No. N 140407 ZRM, for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, concerning Article IX, Chapter 6 to create a special permit in Section 96-32 (Special Regulations in R9 Districts) for the purposes of waiving the applicable height and setback regulations of Sections 23-633 and 23-663, planting regulations of Section 23-892 and permitted obstruction within rear yard regulations of Section 23-44, in Community District 4, Borough of Manhattan (L.U. No. 189).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.

Items.Title: Resolution approving with modifications the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 140408 ZSM (L.U. No. 190), for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-681 of the Zoning Resolution to allow that portion of the railroad or transit right-of-way which will be completely covered over by a permanent platform to be included in the lot area in connection with a proposed residential building with two 15-story segments, on property located at 505-513 West 43rd Street a.k.a. 506-512 West 44th Street (Block 1027, Lot 24), in an R9 District, within the Special Clinton District (Preservation Area), in Community District 4, Borough of Manhattan.

No. 191), for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 96-32(c) of the Zoning Resolution to modify the height and setback requirements of Sections 93-32 (Special Regulations in R9 Districts) and 23-633 (Street wall location and height and setback regulations in certain districts), the rear yard setback requirements of 23-663 (Required rear setbacks for tall buildings in other districts), the permitted obstructions requirements of Section 23-44 (Permitted Obstructions in Required  Yards  or  Rear  Yard  Equivalents), and the planting requirements of Section 23-892 (In R6 through R10 District), in connection with a proposed residential building with two 15-story segments, on property located at 505-513 West 43rd Street a.k.a. 506-512 West 44th Street (Block 1072, Lot 24), in an R9 District, within the Special Clinton District (Preservation Area), in Community District 4, Borough of Manhattan.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.

Resolutions

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending the definition of harassment to include certain buyout offers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Amending the definition of harassment to include certain buyout offers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the commissioner of the department of correction to post a quarterly report regarding the department's grievance system.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring the commissioner of the dept of correction to post a quarterly report regarding the department's grievance system.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the departments of correction and health and mental hygiene to report on cases of injuries to inmates and staff in city jails, and to refer such cases to investigative agencies.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring the depts of correction and health and mental hygiene to report on cases of injuries to inmates and staff in city jails, and to refer such cases to investigative agencies.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the department of education associate degree programs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Department of education associate degree programs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to technical changes to certain pet shop requirements, as added by local laws 5 and 7 for the year 2015.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Technical changes to certain pet shop requirements, as added by local laws 5 and 7 for the year 2015.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to distress signals for passengers in taxicabs, street hail liveries, and for-hire vehicles
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Distress signals for passengers in taxicabs, street hail liveries, and for-hire vehicles.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress and the New York State Legislature to pass and the President of the United States and Governor of the State of New York to sign, legislation to establish October 9th annually, as Haitian Day in recognition of the historic contributions of Haitians to the United States of America
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Establish October 9th annually, as Haitian Day in recognition of the historic contributions of Haitians to the United States of America.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of correction to report on security indicators in city jails, and to repeal section 9-130 of such code, in relation to jail data reporting on adolescents
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of correction to report on security indicators in city jails, and to repeal section 9-130 of such code, jail data reporting on adolescents.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending the district plan of the Lower East Side business improvement district to modify existing services for the district and to change the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance

Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of correction to post a quarterly report on the population demographics of the city's jails.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring that the dept of correction establish a crisis intervention program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to report on student health services.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of education to report on student health services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to technical changes to certain pet shop requirements, as added by local laws 6 and 8 for the year 2015.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Technical changes to certain pet shop requirements, as added by local laws 6 and 8 for the year 2015.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to provide data related to student participation in meals provided by the department in school
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOE to provide data related to student participation in meals provided by the dept in school.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring information regarding subsidized child care.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Requiring information regarding subsidized child care.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a time period for the landmarks preservation commission to take action on an item upon a motion to calendar such item for consideration of landmark status
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Establishing a time period for the landmarks preservation commission to take action on an item upon a motion to calendar such item for consideration of landmark status.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign, legislation that would make killing someone while driving and using a phone or handheld device a felony and seriously injuring someone while driving and using a phone or handheld device, a misdemeanor.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Legislation that would make killing someone while driving and using a phone or handheld device a felony and seriously injuring someone while driving and using a phone or handheld device, a misdemeanor.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a citywide wildlife management plan.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Creation of a citywide wildlife management plan.

Items.Title: Resolution to amend rule 7.60 of the rules of the council in relation to allowing the submission of written and video testimony to public hearings through the council’s website
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Amend rule 7.60 of the rules of the council in relation to allowing the submission of written and video testimony to public hearings through the council’s website.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the City to be responsible for sidewalks outside of buildings owned by or used exclusively by nonprofit organizations.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Requiring the City to be responsible for sidewalks outside of buildings owned by or used exclusively by nonprofit organizations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of correction to submit regular reports regarding the investigations of the use of force by correction officers on inmates
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: DOC to submit regular reports regarding the investigations of the use of force by correction officers on inmates.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the MTA to allow riders travelling within New York City limits to pay a fare for commuter rail equal to that of a MetroCard ride on New York City Transit subways and buses; and allow for free transfers between commuter rail and New York City Transit subways and buses.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: MTA to allow riders travelling within NYC City limits to pay a fare for commuter rail equal to that of a MetroCard ride on NYC Transit subways and buses.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Governors and State Legislatures of New York and New Jersey to maintain the Port Authority Trans-Hudson (PATH) rail system’s operation as a governmental entity.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Maintain the Port Authority Trans-Hudson (PATH) rail system’s operation as a governmental entity.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing certain parking privileges for press vehicles.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Providing certain parking privileges for press vehicles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring a color photograph of designated building janitors in buildings with multiple dwellings
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring a color photograph of designated building janitors in buildings with multiple dwellings

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to provide notice of deaths to certain agencies and to require certain agencies to update records of program beneficiaries on a regular and continuous basis
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of health and mental hygiene to provide notice of deaths to certain agencies and to require certain agencies to update records of program beneficiaries on a regular and continuous basis.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to liability for the cost and expense of sidewalk repairs and for injuries resulting from failure to repair by the owner of a house of worship
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Liability for the cost and expense of sidewalk repairs and for injuries resulting from failure to repair by the owner of a house of worship.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing and commemorating June 21st as World Yoga Day in the City of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Recognizing and commemorating June 21st as World Yoga Day in NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the interest rate applied to unpaid charges for emergency repairs performed by the department of housing preservation and development
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Interest rate applied to unpaid charges for emergency repairs performed by the department of housing preservation and development.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to pass and the Governor to sign, A.53-A/S.2291-A, also known as Nicholas’ Law, which would amend the New York State Penal Law, Environmental Conservation Law and General Business Law by requiring the safe storage of all guns not in the immediate possession or control of the gun owner.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Nicholas’ Law (A.53-A/S.2291-A)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.4279/S.1710, which seeks to amend the New York State Finance Law and  Tax Law, in relation to establishing the police officer protection fund to be made available to the Division of Criminal Justice Services for the purpose of establishing and implementing a program to retrofit all patrol vehicles of the New York Police Department, and thereafter all patrol vehicles of the New York State Police, with bullet-proof glass.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Retrofit police patrol cars with bulletproof glass. (A.4279/S.1710)

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing this and every April as Autism Awareness Month in the City of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.


Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Recognizing this and every April as Autism Awareness Month in the City of NY.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James)
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Thursday, May 14, 2015.



MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk

Clerk of the Council
